Posts.Content: alohamomof3 wrote: Ok, so I would love opinions from any ladies reading this . . . my gyno told me today (since I was in there getting a breast exam to get reassurance since I deal with health anxiety) that focusing my energy on losing weight (I could greatly benefit from losing about 50 pounds!) will lower my risk of developing heart disease, diabetes, and some cancers.  I totally agree with this, as I have read this statement numerous times before in magazines.  She said to focus on exercise, not diet (?) and asked me what types of exercise I enjoy - I enjoy walking, and she said walking isn't effective enough - I don't agree with this, and I was wondering what others think . . . thanks! supermom3  Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: Confusion about how things show up on mammos vs gamma imaging alohamomof3 momo3esb

Posts.Content: alohamomof3 wrote: Hi ladies! I have had unexplained, occasional twinges of pain in my left breast since 2004/05 - numerous mammos, ultrasounds, and exams haven't come up with anything.   I saw my gyno again yesterday about the same concern, and she suggested I try vitamin e, and in the meantime go to the imaging facility I go to for my mammos, etc., and get a fairly new diagnostic test done, called a BSGI, or "breast specific gamma imaging" test. I got lucky and got in this morning for it - when it was done, the tech came back in with the radiologist (who has 20+ years experience with breast imaging!) and showed me a dark spot on the picture of the left breast and told me it was just density - he said the bottoms of my breasts are dense.  He said a cancer spot would show up very black.  He also reminded me that my mammos have always checked out fine.  He said they obviously didn't find the reason for my breast pain, but he was going to report the test as "normal, premenopausal".   I don't know why I feel doubtful about this - I do suffer from OCD and health anxiety, though.  I read somewhere on-line earlier that cancers on mammos show up white.  Could this be different with a gamma imaging test. Thanks! alohahmomof3 Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Confusion about how things show up on mammos vs gamma imaging alohamomof3 momo3esb
